p: On April 28, 2003, WHO eliminated Vietnam from the name list of the SARS-infected area, which made Vietnam the first to get rid of SARS outbreaks. Since then, numerous countries were also ticked off the list. On July 5, 2003, WHO announced to remove Taiwan of China from SARS-affected area list, which is also the last. At present, there is no SARS-affected area around the world, signaling the victory of global battle against SARS. By the end of September 26, 2003, there were in total 8,098 people infected and 774 deceased, with the mortality at 9.5 %.
